sentences.en: A service was held in remembrance of local soldiers killed in the war.
sentences.cn: 为当地阵亡的战士举行了纪念仪式。

sentences.en: Christians eat bread and drink wine in remembrance of Jesus.
sentences.cn: 基督徒以吃面包喝酒纪念耶稣.

sentences.en: Dear young ladies -- I am deeply touched by your remembrance.
sentences.cn: 亲爱的姑娘们, 你们的纪念品使我深受感动.

sentences.en: He had a lively remembrance of his childhood.
sentences.cn: 他对他的童年生活记忆犹新.

sentences.en: He had clung to the remembrance of things past.
He sent me a birthday remembrance.
sentences.cn: 他送给我一件生日礼物.

sentences.en: His personality is his only claim to remembrance.
sentences.cn: 他的人格是唯一值得纪念的.

sentences.en: His remembrance can be overcome by no change of circumstances or opinions.
sentences.cn: 我对他的记忆,无论情况或舆论有何改变,都是不可磨灭的.

sentences.en: I need people's good wishes and remembrance, the more the better.
sentences.cn: 我是需要别人纪念的, 总觉得能多得点好意就好.

sentences.en: It recalled her to the world and the remembrance of yesterday.
sentences.cn: 它使她想起外面的事情和隔天的经过.

sentences.en: Nothing is more fatal to happiness than the remembrance of happiness. ——–Andre Gide.
sentences.cn: 没有什么比回忆幸福更令人痛苦的了。 ——安德鲁。纪德。

sentences.en: On Remembrance Sunday we honour those who died.
sentences.cn: 我们在休战纪念星期日这天向捐躯的人致敬.

sentences.en: Perhaps his stories form a more substantial claim to remembrance.
sentences.cn: 说不定他的短篇小说更值得让人怀念.

sentences.en: The book was published in remembrance of the incident.
sentences.cn: 这本书是为纪念这个事件出版的.

sentences.en: The house had been cleared of every object enforcing the remembrance.
sentences.cn: 这座房子里能勾起人们记忆的所有物件均被消除了.

sentences.en: They wore black in remembrance of those who had died.
sentences.cn: 他们身穿黑色衣服，以纪念那些亡故者。

trans.tran_cn: 回想，回忆，纪念品，记忆，记忆力
trans.tran_en: a memory that you have of a person or event
